alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 10:46AM PST until March 10 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Rain and Snowmelt in... Northern Fresno County in central California... Central Madera County in central California... * Until 100 PM PST. * At 1046 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oakhurst, Crane Valley Reservoir, North Fork, Bass Lake, Peckinpah and Auberry. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
